passages.text: Brazil | Healthcare Services
Hapvida Participações e Investimentos S.A.
Invite | Fireside Chat wapvida

We are hosting a virtual group meeting with Hapvida's IR Director Guilherme Nahuz on Wednesday, September 10, 2025 at 10am ET | 11am BRT | 3pm BST. Hapvida is the main health insurer in Brazil. It operates through a verticalized model, owning hospitals and clinics to serve its clients more efficiently. The company serves more than 8.5 million clients, almost \(20\%\) of the total health insurance users. Register here

Hapvida's background. The company dates back to 1978, but entered the health insurance market in 1993 and adopted a verticalized model in 2004. Since its IPO in 2018, it has expanded aggressively through acquisitions and become Brazil's largest healthcare operator merging with Notre Dame Intermédia. Today, it servers over 8.5 million beneficiaries and has a \(20\%\) share.

The vertical model. The company adopted its innovative verticalized model in 2004, integrating hospitals, clinics, and labs under one roof. This structure enables superior cost control, operational efficiency, and service standardization - creating a competitive edge more difficult to replicate. Additionally, the vertical model allows Hapvida to be the lowest- cost provider in the industry, which is especially valuable during economic downturns - when clients tend to trade down to more affordable plans. Although the model turns healthcare units into cost centers, instead of profit centers, Hapvida still manages to deliver a \(20\% - 25\%\) normalized ROE.

Growth prospects. While the healthcare industry faces structural challenges - such as modest beneficiary growth, intense competition, and limited product differentiation - Hapvida's scale, efficiency, and defensive positioning offer resilience. The company continues to deliver postmerger and seems confident about its growth prospects.

Capital constraints. Tax and capital structure complexities remain, but Hapvida is actively working to unlock significant value from a BRL\\$40bn in goodwill and optimize its corporate setup. Potential changes in capital requirements and/or faster goodwill incorporation could further enhance its equity value.

The invitee. Guilherme Nahuz has 20 years of corporate experience, having coordinated the IR departments of Wilson Sotts and SulAmerica. He holds an MBA and an MSc in Finance from Boston College, and a BSc from University of Massachusetts Lowell. He has been Hapvida's IR Director for over 40 years.

Hapvida Participacoes e Investimentos S.A.

Hapvida Participacoes e Investimentos S.A. Hapvida Participacoes e Investimentos S.A. is the main health insurers in Brazil. It operates through a verticalized model, owning hospitals and clinics to serve its clients more efficiently. The company was founded in 1979 by Candido Pinheiro in Fortaleza, Brazil, and it is still headquartered there. Today, the company serves more than 8.5 million clients, almost \(20\%\) of the total health insurance users.

Our price target is set using a DDM approach. Key risks include macroeconomic conditions, affecting GDP growth, unemployment rate, inflation, and interest rates; changes in the healthcare regulatory environment; fencer underwriting competition with health insurers; and changes in the Brazilian tax and fiscal regime. Additionally, according to Hapvida 2025 Reference Form (pages 120, 121 and 229 to 236), the independent auditors identified material weaknesses in the company internal controls during 2023 and 2024. In 2023, these included: (i) absence of a robust model for expected credit losses, and (ii) deficiencies in goodwill impairment testing. In 2024, auditors wrote a "Report of recommendations for improving internal controls". There, auditors (i) required prior-period errors restatements; (ii) verified a reconciliation backlog of BRL\\$483 million in December 2024 - later reduced to BRL\\$26.7 million; and (iii) noticed significant challenges implementing IFRS 17, including a) lack of data governance, b) undocumented system changes, and c) absence of formal accounting policies and critical assumptions. Management committed to resolving all remaining issues by 31 December 2025. Hapvida changed its auditing firm to Deloitte in November 2024; they claimed PwC would be responsible for cybersecurity, thus it is not recommended to perform the general auditing.
Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR) Recommendation Published Recommendation Distributed
Antonio Pedro Cardoso holds a long equity position in Hapvida Participacoes e Investimentos S.A.

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company. NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a \(15\%\) stop loss, and the remainder will have a \(20\%\) stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
- Havpida Participações e Investimentos S.A. (HAPV3 BZ: R\(39.80, HOLD)
